reviewText:
If you check out most of my reviews, they are just under 1000 words long. Usually, I feel the need to write a long review talking about what I feel is important. This is not such a case.

In short, it's a lot like Big Rigs, but better.

This game is... dreadful, but also kind of fun. The main reason its fun is because of how lighthearted it is, and how colourful everything is, along with the pleasent, if repetitive music.

But it's also completely broken is almost every possible way. The environments are glitchy, the car controls kind of crappily, the controls don't really work sometimes, and there isn't really much of a goal except to collect all the stuff in the level and go to the next...

It really just that simple. Here's a level, collect the stuff, move on. That's it. No racing. No real need to do stunts at all. It's just... here. Drive around and collect stuff.

Just to give an example of how broken this game is, I came across a bug after 4 mintues of playing where, if I jumped, and then held the backwards key (s" for me)

reviewText: this game is quite fun for all ages it's not hard to unlock everything in the game in 2 or 3 hours  I can see myself playing this game for over 200 hours. the things i really like are the fact you can control the car in the air and land anywhere you want by simply using nitro or steering it you can even climb up walls to get to where your going. landing every possible trick is done by learning how to control it in the air and i have almost mastered flight controls. this is one of those sleeper games where nobody pays attention to it but it's going to get super popular in time when friends see friends playing it for 200 hours or more like my friends will see. I recommend this game for everyone because in time i know the few minor bugs will be fixed and it will still be the perfect little game for everyone. reviewText: Picked this up in a bundle alongside a couple of games I actually wanted, and actually this is quite fun. If you ever played Re-Volt and liked finding the stars, this is basically that. Or, the parts of Carmageddon 2 where you were doing missions jumping from roof to roof. It's kind of almost like a car platform game. The controls (I used an Xbox 360 controller, which it does support, though doesn't actually tell you the button mapping or allow you to change it, but the default mapping makes sense to my hands) didn't quite feel right to start off with, but after a few minutes I got the hang of it and was able to control my stunt jumps quite nicely. It feels a little unfinished in places and I kind of wanted more than is available in terms of gameplay, but for a few quid, it's definitely worth it.

reviewText:
Well what a surprise, this is actually a pretty neat little game. It has native Xbox 360 controller support, although there's nothing in the options or menus telling you what does what... it's not hard to figure out.

The controls feel a little touchy at first. Okay, a lot touchy. You have to make corrections quickly and there's not much margin for error, but you're controlling what's basically an R/C car that can take a lot of punishment, so it's okay.

The game starts out with nothing but an open world type map with all these powerups and collectibles scattered around everywhere. You have to build coins out of fragments to unlock more maps, vehicles, and game modes, but starting out you have access to 3-4 different vehicles so it's not bad. As you go through the level you also collect upgrades for your current car - things like nitro, super jump, low gravity, extra health, etc. The challenge is to figure out how to jump or climb up to the hard to reach spots to get your goodies. There's no penalty for dying, you just respawn at a random location, sometimes way up in the air.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, you have full control over your pitch and roll while in the air, so you're basically like a cat in that way. If you're good at being a cat, you'll always land on your feet... err... tires. If not, if you land on your nose or roof, you'll probably go boom if you're high enough.

You can switch camera angles. I found it's easiest to control spin from the bumper cam, but the disadvantage is it's harder to see where the roads, ramps, and hills lead off to. There's no way to adjust where you're looking, it's always straight ahead, except in third person, then the camera faces whatever direction you're going. There's a button to do a full 180 reverse, and another button to do a quick stop. It's not like a handbrake, it's to stop completely. This is useful for planting yourself on hard to reach ledges after you had to take a running jump to get to it. I keep forgetting that's what it's for but there it is.

So, this game is cheap, it's goofy, it's fun, and with so many things to unlock and maps to explore, I think it's well worth it for the price. Thumbs up! A solid 7/10 at least. Good fun.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
The Short Version: 7/10, but keep in mind this is a driving exploration game, not a racing game. You'll be disappointed if you expect Mario Cart. Think Spyro's hub worlds in a car, and graphics like the original Spyro.

Long Version: I'm two levels in and I have to say this game is exactly what I wanted. You drive an RC car around a large area collecting hidden things and doing tricks. I have a couple of complaints, however. Doing tricks doesn't seem to do anything but flash some text; It'd be nice if there were more motivation for me to rack up score or soemthing. There doesn't seem to be a functional difference between the cars, and they all cost one coin to unlock (you get a coin by finding three parts in a level.) So after you've found one coin you'll unlock the car you like and after that there's no incentive to unlock more. The graphics are pretty rudimentary, and in places you'll think you're playing a PS1 game.
Despite these issues, the game is still fun if you like exploring an area and collecting things in a vehicle. It brings back memories of playing Diddy Kong Racing and San Francisco Rush 2049's stunt mode, and is comparable to the drive-around-collect-stuff mode from Joyride Turbo on Xbox 360. I only wish this game's player investment system had gotten a bit more attention.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: Really fun game for just messing about. it's got happy and bouncy music to go along with the cute visials. I've only 2 problems with the game, neither of which are serious. 1. camera can be a bit confusing, and 2. sometimes, in certan levels, when you respawn, you fly up into the air really high. I've only noticed it in junkyard and warehouse, but I've only unlocked these levels. Sitll good game & worth the 5 bucks.

STUNTMANIA Reloaded is a basic free-roaming racer involving several gigantic maps that have all sorts of hidden and secret areas to explore. Each of the ~10 maps feature hundreds of jumps and stunts, complete with large amounts of green, yellow, and red collectables to gather in each level. Also in each stage, there are 3 types of coins that need to be gathered in-order to unlock certain parts of the game. Some coins need to be gathered in 3 pieces, which will be spread around the map. column23: and you wait around 2 seconds for it to respawn. Around 1/7 of the time your car will respawn being shot up into the air like a cannon and stay airborne for a good 40 seconds
column24: leaving you with nothing to do but wait. Once that car comes crashing down again
column25: unless you've picked up the "Mega Health" powerup
column26: there's a 50/50 chance that you won't survive the fall
column27: with the possibility of respawning shot up into the air once more. However
column28: I have come to a slight realization of the glitch and it is if you've crashed with your car's nose tipped mildly upwards
column29: it seems to bring up the glitch. An easy way to stabilize your car is holding down SPACE
column30: but this is still unconfirmed as far as I know. In the game I guarantee that you'll find your car glitching through the map either fully
column32: even if you can make it out with a small hop. And
column33: I've also taken note that you can literally drive up a flat wall
column36: without any powerups or any help or tricks.\n\nNow
column37: I will say that this game is relaxing
column40: but the glitches that this game possesses just seem to ruin the fun for most people. The price just doesn't seem like it's worth it's value if it's possessed by such bugs and broken mechanics
column42: this game demonstrated to me amazing levels
column43: and breathtaking and cool stunts and jumps and loops; This game is its own rollercoaster. But
column44: even all of this doesn't top for the game's value. The only time I would recommend to buy this game is when it's on sale
column45: or in Humble Bundle or other such sorts."

reviewText:
Good:the game can be fun and the cars have fun but also glitchy physix and works with a 360 controler.

Bad:the game is buggy as hell and creates a crash report everytime i close it and not just when it crashs and it does crash pretty often lol.also the cars glitch through the ground at times especialy when hitting ramps, instead of going over them you get stuck in them or they flip you over or blow you up,also respawns sometimes send you tumbling into space
the game feels early beta at best and defenatly needs work. it be worth a $1 but defenatly not $5 got mine in a bundle so no hurt feelings here:)
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: StuntMANIA Reloaded is a fun and charming do what you want, car game. Sure it's got some bugs, camera issues, respawning issues, textures not loading, but for $5 it really isn't a bad game. The music for the game is very interesting and is fun to listen to, and the ideas for the levels are really cool (Mini Golf is probably my favorite). There is a nice small selection of cars to choose from and having to collect coins to unlock them, levels, and game modes let's you search every nook and cranny on the map. Some pieces are difficult to find, but it shouldn't take long to get all the coins on every level. Go Crazy is a neat feature, no time pressure or objective really, you can go nuts and drive to your hearts desire, blowing up your car as many times as you want. One thing I really wish that would have been added were nice backdrops. It gets boring looking out into the gray/black outside of the arena, though this is a smaller issue. All in all, this is a good game for $5, even if it was $10. It's not the game of the year, but the developer clearly had a great idea in their head, and did a great job of making a fun game.
